With roles like machin ... e learning software to structural analysis, the   Autonomous Underwater Vehicles Team at Berkeley  is the underwater robotics competition you've been looking for all this time! Full speed ahead to RoboSub 2019!   See More Blum Ctr October 29, 2018 at 3:27 PM Hello underwater innovators! 

EVENT REMINDER TOMORROW: Writing Work ... shop - Oct 30, 6pm (Blum Hall)

Big Ideas is hosting a Writing Workshop to provide guidance and feedback on how to effectively craft your pre-proposal for any type of social impact idea you are trying to scale.

This workshop will also include a presentation on project and pitch storytelling techniques led by Scott Shigeoka, Community & Design Lead at OpenIDEO.

With the pre-proposal deadline (Nov. 14) just a few weeks away, don't miss this opportunity to ask questions and learn what makes a successful proposal.  https://www.facebook.com/events/679921079059408/?active_tab=about   See More English (US)  ·  Español  ·  Português (Brasil)  ·  Français (France)  ·  Deutsch Privacy  ·  Terms  ·  Advertising  ·  Ad Choices  ·  Cookies  ·  More  Facebook © 2021 Underwater Robotics at Berkeley  added an  event . January 16, 2020  ·  Underwater Robotics at Berkeley January 16, 2020  ·  # tbt  to our first 'underwater' vehicle:  Over 3 years ago, Boaty McBoat Face was a concept vehicle when AUVs at Berkeley was in its infancy. The team needed a way to unify our vision for a robot submarine with very little resources and technical expertise. Constructing this cardboard model raised questions on vehicle dynamics, propulsion systems, form factor, and other areas that would later be investigated through developing Smol Bot and Project Blue.  Check out our underwater vehicles at  https://www.ocf.berkeley.edu/~auvs/vehicles Underwater Robotics at Berkeley June 24, 2019  ·  We have a new website! Check it out here:  https://www.ocf.berkeley.edu/~auvs/ Autonomous Underwater Vehicles @Berkeley – Not your typical robot. Autonomous Underwater Vehicles @Berkeley – Not your typical robot. Click here!  https://biggive.berkeley.edu/ Underwater Robotics at Berkeley March 11, 2019  ·  We're hosting a GPU Analytics Workshop for UC Berkeley students and the community with our sponsor,  OmniSci  on 3/13/2019 at 210 Jacobs Hall, 6:30pm! Join us for fun, hacking, and food!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dJGVV0VzK1U OmniSci is the GPU-accelerated platform used in business and government to find insights in big data beyond the limits of mainstream analytics tools.
